mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The General Assembly built the Old State House to replace an earlier wooden courthouse built 1730. The building was extensively renovated and dramatically altered several times in the 19th century. The Old State House was used as a Court House until 1975 and is now home to the Rhode Island Historical Preservation Commission. -- http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Old_State_House_%28Providence,_Rhode_Island%29 [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
